hook.text: Cities sue oil companies for climate damages. Children sue governments for inaction. Climate law goes to court.

buildup.text: Climate litigation uses courts to hold governments and companies accountable for climate inaction or deception.

discovery.text: Over 2,300 climate cases filed worldwide. Most target governments, but fossil fuel companies face growing suits.

twist.text: Courts struggle with standing and causation: can you prove a specific company caused your specific climate harm?

climax.text: Juliana v. US argued children have a right to a stable climate. The case was dismissed but inspired many more.

punchline.text: When legislatures stall, courts become the climate battleground.
